description.narrative: - The Project aims at supporting a well-managed regional bank in Romania through strengthening its capital base. With increased capitalization, the Bank will be able to pursue its growth strategy and maintain its systemic presence. - As micro, small and medium-sized enterprises are a strategic priority for BT, the Project will help improve access to finance for SMEs by providing capital support needed to expand Bank''s operations.

The proposed IFC investment is a subordinated loan of up to US$40 million to Banca Transilvania S.A. (the Bank or BT), to be fully provided by the IFCs Capitalization Fund. The loan, to be counted as Tier II capital, is expected to have a 10 years maturity period with a bullet repayment. The project aims to support a systemic bank in Romania through strengthening its capital base. BT, third largest bank in Romania, is a long-time client of IFC. The Bank, established in 1993, operates as a full-scale commercial bank in Romania.
